intro: Hasseltia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lepidote, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
